Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Coagulation Management in Cardiothoracic Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: Participants were eligible if they were undergoing cardiothoracic surgery and met specific inclusion criteria.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received tranexamic acid and heparin, supplemented with nonpharmacological techniques, while the control group received standard care.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the reduction in postoperative bleeding, measured over a 24-hour period.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence, with allocation concealment ensured by sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was applied to outcome assessors.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 200 participants were randomised, with 100 in each group, between January 2020 and June 2021.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Analysis was conducted on 98 participants in the intervention group and 97 in the control group using an intention-to-treat approach.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The intervention group showed a significant reduction in postoperative bleeding (mean difference = 5.2 mL, 95% CI 3.1 to 7.3; p = 0.01).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were reported in 3% of the intervention group and 1% of the control group.
